commit_message:
Add testinfra 3rd party testing

Run the system-config-run-base-ansible-devel test against testinfra
pull requests.  This test installs ansible and testinfra from upstream
and then runs our base playbooks, giving a good smoke-test of any big
issues.

Discussed with upstream @

 https://github.com/philpep/testinfra/pull/436#issuecomment-489784345

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/656908
Change-Id: Ifc763ba54bff9be4aabd6ac1ce176140648e209e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-03 20:50:46.000000000', 'message': 'Use hashes for the upgrade playbook markers

The run-upgrades script only checked and used the base filename of
a playbook when creating markers for each completed playbook.
This prevented the same playbook from being run multiple times with
different provided extra variables, each subsequent run of the same
playbook would be skipped.

Instead use hashed values of each entire playbook run item string as the
markers of completed upgrade playbooks.

Change-Id: If2733f12d45c1a0e0d7fb799e2520e0696a453f7
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse@odyssey4.me>
'}, {'created': '2019-05-08 13:05:33.000000000', 'message': 'Use hashes for the upgrade playbook markers

This prevented the same playbook from being run multiple times with

playbook would be skipped.

commit_message:
Use hashes for the upgrade playbook markers

The run-upgrades script only checked and used the base filename of
a playbook when creating markers for each completed playbook.
This prevented the same playbook from being run multiple times with
different provided extra variables, each subsequent run of the same
playbook would be skipped.

Instead use hashed values of each entire playbook run item string as the
markers of completed upgrade playbooks.

Change-Id: If2733f12d45c1a0e0d7fb799e2520e0696a453f7
Co-Authored-By: Jesse Pretorius <jesse@odyssey4.me>

commit_message:
Allow cmd to can be used on other systems than linux

Some specific path (linux path /proc/self/fd) are in use in the source
code and we try to listdir on this path so if we use oslo.rootwrap on
other platform we risk to facing an issue.

Change-Id: I27b4669a274b59998cb0a62a2f02bb5604db7862

commit_message:
Move elastic-curator to its own chart

This moves elastic-curator to a chart separate from Elasticsearch.
This allows for easier updates to Curator's configuration without
having to upgrade the Elasticsearch release.

This also updates the Curator version to 5.6 to take advantage of
an updated list of available actions, such as shrinking indices

Change-Id: Ic82e20cb9c6dbb92654581ac0134a4ef0a52f93f

commit_message:
Fix setup.cfg syntax error, not allowed comment in files section

In [files] section of setup.cfg there is not allowed comment, which
breaks installation with setup.py.

Change-Id: I38fce0a6c155e4b7d2ff7a2535f18e8adc2566e9
Story: 2005546

commit_message:
Clean up leftover mount point after docker stop.

Some mountpoints are left on the host after docker shut down.  This
seems to be an issue with docker, but couldn't trace it back to a
specific docker bug.

In the meantime to unblock the upgrade CI we make sure that every
mount point under /var/lib/docker are umounted before deleting that
directory.

Note that we need to keep the order right, so that we do a depth first
list so that umount can do leaves before root.

Closes-Bug: #1826375
Co-Authored-By: Sofer Athlan-Guyot <sathlang@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a8ec69941657975fe6a2b8616c3c729013a30dff)

Change-Id: I03a065556caca4385bb8b28be0dfbe21addbf003

commit_message:
Clean up leftover mount point after docker stop.

Some mountpoints are left on the host after docker shut down.  This
seems to be an issue with docker, but couldn't trace it back to a
specific docker bug.

In the meantime to unblock the upgrade CI we make sure that every
mount point under /var/lib/docker are umounted before deleting that
directory.

Note that we need to keep the order right, so that we do a depth first
list so that umount can do leaves before root.

Closes-Bug: #1826375
Co-Authored-By: Sofer Athlan-Guyot <sathlang@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I03a065556caca4385bb8b28be0dfbe21addbf003

commit_message:
Rephrase CinderPassword parameter description

Change [1] for adding CinderPassword in nova.conf failed
 on pep8 because of MisMatched parameter definitions.

Rephrasing the CinderPassword parameter description to
make is generic so that it could be used in other service
templates easily.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657919/

Change-Id: Id9590c24832e5ead23759e70dc537baa0d79de75

commit_message:
Replace git.openstack.org with opendev.org

This patch replaces git.openstack.org with opendev.org as redirection
from old path was enabled.
Path do not fix path in run_tests.sh and scripts/scripts-library.sh as
I'm not really sure whether it's safe to change now.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/653978/
Change-Id: I700fa432c88e77ca1b0e29667d04bfbb67829735

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-07 11:43:32.000000000', 'message': 'Use migration_status during volume migrating and retyping

When swapping volumes Nova has to identify if the swap itself is related
to an underlying migration or retype of the volume by Cinder.  Nova
would previously use the status of the volume to determine if the volume
was retyping or migrating.

However in the migration case where a volume is moved directly between
hosts the volume is never given a status  of migrating by Cinder leading
to Nova never calling the os-migrate_volume_completion cinder API to
complete the migration.

This change switches Nova to use the migration_status of the volume to
ensure that this API is called for both retypes and migrations.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639331/
Change-Id: I1bdf3431bda2da98380e0dcaa9f952e6768ca3af
Closes-bug: #1803961
(cherry picked from commit 53c3cfa7a02d684ce27800e22e00a816af44c510)
(cherry picked from commit 91282f879cb453e4baa6c6decb4fff849c7a1b2a)
'}]
commit_message:
Use migration_status during volume migrating and retyping

When swapping volumes Nova has to identify if the swap itself is related
to an underlying migration or retype of the volume by Cinder.  Nova
would previously use the status of the volume to determine if the volume
was retyping or migrating.

However in the migration case where a volume is moved directly between
hosts the volume is never given a status  of migrating by Cinder leading
to Nova never calling the os-migrate_volume_completion cinder API to
complete the migration.

This change switches Nova to use the migration_status of the volume to
ensure that this API is called for both retypes and migrations.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639331/
Change-Id: I1bdf3431bda2da98380e0dcaa9f952e6768ca3af
Closes-bug: #1803961
(cherry picked from commit 53c3cfa7a02d684ce27800e22e00a816af44c510)
(cherry picked from commit 91282f879cb453e4baa6c6decb4fff849c7a1b2a)

subject: Add cinder extras requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-06 15:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-06 15:21:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Typically when we add a new requirement, we want a set of questions answered about each one:

https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/dependency-management.html#for-new-requirements

This is a little different though. These really have been dependencies of Cinder for a long time now, we just handled the management of them poorly and this is now attempting to get things right.

I'll leave it up to Matt if we need to break this out for each and have those questions answered."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-06 15:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to driver_exceptions'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-06 15:32:03.000000000', 'content': 'Topic driver_exceptions removed'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-06 19:14:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-06 21:14:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I think we still need the questions answered, at the very least we need the licences checked, but if we are adding it to GR that kinda means we looked at it at least once for maintainability, testing, activity, etc.  It'd probably be easiest to do this all at once, the licence info is in the commit (GR comments), so that's one step."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-07 14:25:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't know the answers to the questions as I don't maintain the libraries.   I can vouch for the hpe python libs as I created those years ago, but without this patch, we cannot add the optional extras to cinder to make sure the required libraries are available for our drivers."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-07 14:38:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm going to start reviewing them today, will likely make one comment per library reviewing them."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-07 19:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-08 04:16:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(12 comments)

there are a few problems, mainly with stuff that is not active anymore and not py3, but of those are kinda hard stoppers'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-08 11:23:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So which libs can we get in and which can't get in?
The reason we are adding these is so cinder can support
running the volume service in a container image by automatically pulling in the required driver libraries."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-08 14:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(3 comments)

shall I break this patch up into individual patches for each library?'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-08 17:04:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > shall I break this patch up into individual patches for each
 > library?

I suggest breaking this into 2 changes.  1 with all the ones that are okay) and one for the final 3.

We can get the first one merged this week while we work through the problems.  On the cinder side you can use the exiting change and make it depend on the second (new) change or make the same split as you're doing here"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-05-08 19:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Can you fill out the new requirement template for each of those? I guess one review per requirement would be the best solution'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-05-09 14:26:39.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Migrated this patch into separate patches for each cinder driver's libraries."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-06 15:03:44.000000000', 'message': "Add cinder extras requirements

This patch adds the 3rd party driver requirements for cinder's
drivers that have pypi installable packages.   We are adding
extras to cinder's setup.cfg, and need these requirements added
here to pass the requirements-check.  The Cinder patch is here:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656724/

Change-Id: Ia8f848a60440d28b20b09f1a83c72a6733e3f523
"}, {'created': '2019-05-06 19:14:47.000000000', 'message': "Add cinder extras requirements

drivers that have pypi installable packages.   We are adding
extras to cinder's setup.cfg, and need these requirements added
here to pass the requirements-check.  The Cinder patch is here:

Change-Id: Ia8f848a60440d28b20b09f1a83c72a6733e3f523

commit_message:
Add cinder extras requirements

This patch adds the 3rd party driver requirements for cinder's
drivers that have pypi installable packages.   We are adding
extras to cinder's setup.cfg, and need these requirements added
here to pass the requirements-check.  The Cinder patch is here:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656724/

Change-Id: Ia8f848a60440d28b20b09f1a83c72a6733e3f523

commit_message:
gate: stop getting VERSION_ID

This variable is not used at all in our testing and it's not always
available in all operating systems (i.e. buster)

Change-Id: I43146f1e6d70add9f4c175d5b86987d348e70073

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-03 16:00:52.000000000', 'message': "Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I15554bf3c109045ebdc237ce7cb40299f5d1b298
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Handle collections.abc deprecations

The use of ABC classes directly from collections has been deprecated in
3.x versions of Python. The direction is to use the classes defined in
collections.abc. Python 2.7 does not have this, but Python 3.8 will be
dropping the backwards compatibility to use the old location.

Six also does not have support for this yet, so in the mean time to make
sure we don't run into issues as folks try to move to 3.8, and to get
rid of deprecation warnings in logs, this handles importing from the
preferred location and falls back if it not available.

Change-Id: I15554bf3c109045ebdc237ce7cb40299f5d1b298
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Release python-ironicclient 2.6.2 and 2.7.1

Releases new python-ironicclient versions from rocky and
stein branches in order to address a issue with version
negotiation that can occur with ironic deployed to multiple
regions.

Change-Id: I0486fb5ce4c6c4285fb4e54757e81bca01ca6f56

Thank you Arne.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-05-09 10:34:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thanks, Shivanand. It depends on how one would like to do the RAID setup. We currently do this in our deployment via the automatic cleaning (which requires the deploy interface), but I'm happy to move this to the RAID interface if there is general consensus that it should behave exactly like h/w RAID and require the deployer to go through an additional manual cleaning step. Maybe deploy steps will be the way out and satisfy both?"}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2019-05-09 13:18:23.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Abandoned as s/w RAID is moved to 'raid' interface."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-08 12:55:48.000000000', 'message': "Software RAID: Set raid_config via post clean hook

Update the node's raid_config after creation. Since RAID creation
and deletion are done via the deploy interface in the generic h/w
manager, this patch adds the post clean step hook to this interface.

Since automatic cleaning calls create_configuration() even if the
target_raid_config is empty (which is the case when it is removed),
this patch also adds a try/catch block in the code path to account
for this.

Change-Id: I35c59bb9d0edaf130b976ad84a9eb40ddffd9617
Story: #2004581
Task: #30114
"}]
commit_message:
Software RAID: Set raid_config via post clean hook

Update the node's raid_config after creation. Since RAID creation
and deletion are done via the deploy interface in the generic h/w
manager, this patch adds the post clean step hook to this interface.

Since automatic cleaning calls create_configuration() even if the
target_raid_config is empty (which is the case when it is removed),
this patch also adds a try/catch block in the code path to account
for this.

Change-Id: I35c59bb9d0edaf130b976ad84a9eb40ddffd9617
Story: #2004581
Task: #30114

commit_message:
Use 'DEFAULT_VALIDATIONS_BASEDIR' variable from constants.py

Instead of using 'TRIPLEO_VALIDATIONS' as an hardcoded variable, this
patch will use 'DEFAULT_VALIDATIONS_BASEDIR' variable coming from
constants.py.

Change-Id: I5c08ca0bfb9923f7b6834f0d14464c60320f6e6f
Implements: blueprint inflight-validations
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ab490622a290aa6f662926eacc0745cd94deca73)

commit_message:
Raise API max version for Rocky updates

Functionality was added during rocky, but the MAX_VERSION of the client
was not updated for these versions. This raises the version to support
the added functionality.

3.53 - Schema validation - no client changes
3.54 - Add mode option to attachment-create:
    I22cfddd0192c4a72b8f844f23d1fa51b96c57e06
3.55 - Transfer snapshots with volumes
    I61a84b5abf386a4073baea57d8820c8fd762ae03

This patch adds a release note to the cherry pick indicated below.

Change-Id: I8c8fb8f552e529c8474a3e3b771ba8eb7aed193a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b843a168efc9261a12ebe322fe701ef355474874)
(cherry picked from commit ee37f267354a8dfe5d4b9b05c261bf86f329cfb8)

[{'created': '2019-05-03 12:27:54.000000000', 'message': "Expose innodb_lock_wait_timeout via hieradata.

Along the same lines of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603996/.
This commits expoxes one more knob to the operators, allowing them
to tweak the value of innodb_lock_wait_timeout (default = 50).
From upstream docs:

~~~
Time in seconds that an InnoDB transaction waits for an InnoDB
row lock (not table lock) before giving up with the error
ERROR 1205 (HY000): Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction.
When this occurs, the statement (not transaction) is rolled back.
~~~

As for the other parameters it defaults to 'undef' so to keep the
default value of 50.

Change-Id: Ic2e1666ad39762caf9bf68272fdb00ee42658bb8
"}]
commit_message:
Expose innodb_lock_wait_timeout via hieradata.

Along the same lines of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603996/.
This commits expoxes one more knob to the operators, allowing them
to tweak the value of innodb_lock_wait_timeout (default = 50).
From upstream docs:

~~~
Time in seconds that an InnoDB transaction waits for an InnoDB
row lock (not table lock) before giving up with the error
ERROR 1205 (HY000): Lock wait timeout exceeded; try restarting transaction.
When this occurs, the statement (not transaction) is rolled back.
~~~

As for the other parameters it defaults to 'undef' so to keep the
default value of 50.

Change-Id: Ic2e1666ad39762caf9bf68272fdb00ee42658bb8

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: Ic9a1d55bc9c0b1f00c444595a774246f0d993a21
Sem-Ver: feature

Replace git.openstack.org with opendev.org

This patch replaces git.openstack.org with opendev.org as redirection
from old path was enabled.

Change-Id: I8a070e0aded59dd7a4751218bd95bc23d153c6d3

commit_message:
Clean metrics related environments

This patch groups all metrics related environment files
to single directory and changes it's name to make more
sense.It also adds environment file for enabling RabbitMQ
monitoring.

Co-Authored-By: Nagasai Vinaykumar Kapalavai <vkapalav@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8419ef82e79d1e26c7b1fc267feadf909a7978d9
Depends-On: I248859bf0e4b70e3a057e96b5fb74be64f4008ed

commit_message:
Add 'SUPPORT_BW_CONFIG' option to VIFs

Not all VIFs support bandwidth configuration. This property provides a
way to determine that that isn't based on checking object names.

Change-Id: I25b46a0ea6924c41ac8d2ae673d6534fad2e0943
Related-Bug: #1814882

Made changes to the _wait_until_stack_ready method to make it generic

Change-Id: If1f7f60c6c98f90fa57ac79d17a813f0dac13322

commit_message:
Refactor _wait_until_stack_ready method to remove duplicate code

Made changes to the _wait_until_stack_ready method to make it generic
for all *_wait methods so that the duplicate code from the respective
*_wait methods can be deleted.

commit_message:
Make standalone-upgrade job vote&gate & add to standalone template

This makes standalone-upgrade job voting and adds it to the gate
jobs.

It also adds the standalone/f28/standalone-upgrade into the
tripleo-standalone-scenarios-full template. Tracked by the
tripleo ci squad in [1]

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/us/959

commit_message:
Add sqlite package to manila-share

The docker image was built without sqlite package, which is required for
nfs backend. Without this package manila-share fails to start.

Change-Id: I2f7d8c283393ca947a1d51c6e3cd20e888fbc3e4
Closes-Bug: #1824511

commit_message:
Add become:true to virtualenv installation task

This commit adds a 'become: true' to the 'package' task responsible
for installing virtualenv. Depending on the environment this is
likely required/mandatory.

Additional background: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656933

Change-Id: Ifc1d56cda2e3b32dedd2dd5637fc5e647dd148cc

commit_message:
Use HTTP code 307 for redirects

Changed HTTP redirect code from 302 to 307 to ensure the
original HTTP method is left intact. Otherwise some clients
may change PUT/POST to GET on redirect and effectively fail
to perform the change they intended.

Change-Id: I32613e1ebb4a2eaba33c5884ddbd3ec7cf77d6fd
Story: 2005370
Task: 30346

messages: [{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-09 09:02:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-05-09 09:47:10.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned\n\nWhile this is true, it will totally not work as is -- the base image needs to get the extra devel repo, and in ALL cases, librdkafka-devel is old (0.11.6) and won't build in recent branches. It's worth doing a different way."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-09 09:02:38.000000000', 'message': 'Build confluent-kafka from source on openSUSE

When not fetching the wheel, confluent-kafka (used in monasca)
needs to have librdkafka-devel installed on openSUSE Leap15.

For Leap 15.1, this does not require extra repos.
For Leap 15.0, this requires the devel repo.

Change-Id: I8539ec3590f751dce5e78473aededb648cecc73c
'}]
commit_message:
Build confluent-kafka from source on openSUSE

When not fetching the wheel, confluent-kafka (used in monasca)
needs to have librdkafka-devel installed on openSUSE Leap15.

For Leap 15.1, this does not require extra repos.
For Leap 15.0, this requires the devel repo.

Change-Id: I8539ec3590f751dce5e78473aededb648cecc73c

commit_message:
Create libvirt boot loader element if needed

When dynamic Redfish emulator:

 * is running against libvirt backend and
 * node boot mode is being set and
 * boot loader path is not empty
 * <os><loader> element is not present in libvirt domain
   configuration

Then create <os><loader> element in `readOnly` mode (to
force libvirt using a private copy of the loader for environment
variables). If boot loader path is empty, then remove
<os><loader> element if it was present at all.

The rationale is to ensure well-formed domain configuration
upon boot mode change.

Change-Id: Id434be3287ab158a25e8c091ec23be281da29915

commit_message:
Use timesync service

The Ntp service should no longer defined on the roles as we should be
using the meta Timesync service to ensure the correct service is defined
for the sync service.

Change-Id: Ic2fb3291de78891d05ef12e3778263fe74fbff8c
Related-Blueprint: tripleo-chrony
Closes-Bug: #1827676
(cherry picked from commit 90562b6f5d17240e59a7f229091e704da2c0ff62)

will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4c546e83502437e875dc2ded744268b8353a7d99

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-08 12:11:38.000000000', 'message': "Allocate IP addresses for metadata port also when DHCP is disabled

Prior to this patch, when DHCP is disabled for a subnet, the metadata
port doesn't get an IP address allocated for that subnet which leaves
metadata service unprovisioned.

This patch is removing that restriction and as long as metadata is
enabled, an IP address will be still allocated for it.

Change-Id: Id7498051a621f8da310e60d440ad2095898ece88
Closes-Bug: #1828213
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Allocate IP addresses for metadata port also when DHCP is disabled

Prior to this patch, when DHCP is disabled for a subnet, the metadata
port doesn't get an IP address allocated for that subnet which leaves
metadata service unprovisioned.

This patch is removing that restriction and as long as metadata is
enabled, an IP address will be still allocated for it.

Change-Id: Id7498051a621f8da310e60d440ad2095898ece88
Closes-Bug: #1828213
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Uses neutron_lib's rpc module

The module neutron.common.rpc has been deprecated and removed in favor of
neutron_lib.rpc.

neutron_lib.rpc has been introduced in neutron-lib==1.18.0.

Change-Id: Iea1db96069959aa8c1fd8c88ee2c39b947975723
(cherry picked from commit d8f527a355a757bb083954b4717a56a74f816d2a)

commit_message:
Using node replace resource_id in method add_action_disable_node()

We have a bp to add resource_name in action input parameter field.

Before doing this, one of this method's parameter should be node
instead of resource_id.

Change-Id: I4ce5ae97efce98d80a460fd6003df3cc5cacab82

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-08 17:14:44.000000000', 'message': 'Make the parser in nova_wait_for_compute_service less strict

Currently the script will barf if nova.conf has duplicate keys:
configparser.DuplicateOptionError: While reading from '/etc/nova/nova.conf' [line 8669]: option 'passthrough_whitelist' in section 'pci' already exists

Let's fix it by not using a strict parser.
Before the fix:
[root@compute-0 ~]# python3 test.py nova.conf.broken
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 8, in <module>
    config.read(nova_cfg)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/configparser.py", line 697, in read
    self._read(fp, filename)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/configparser.py", line 1092, in _read
    fpname, lineno)
configparser.DuplicateOptionError: While reading from 'nova.conf.broken' [line 8703]: option 'passthrough_whitelist' in section 'pci' already exists

After the fix:
[root@compute-0 ~]# python3 test.py nova.conf.broken
compute-0.localdomain

Change-Id: Ie177d09222b9d364e58deed402855462f463c06a
Closes-Bug: #1828269
'}]
commit_message:
Make the parser in nova_wait_for_compute_service less strict

Currently the script will barf if nova.conf has duplicate keys:
configparser.DuplicateOptionError: While reading from '/etc/nova/nova.conf' [line 8669]: option 'passthrough_whitelist' in section 'pci' already exists

Let's fix it by not using a strict parser.
Before the fix:
[root@compute-0 ~]# python3 test.py nova.conf.broken
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test.py", line 8, in <module>
    config.read(nova_cfg)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/configparser.py", line 697, in read
    self._read(fp, filename)
  File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/configparser.py", line 1092, in _read
    fpname, lineno)
configparser.DuplicateOptionError: While reading from 'nova.conf.broken' [line 8703]: option 'passthrough_whitelist' in section 'pci' already exists

After the fix:
[root@compute-0 ~]# python3 test.py nova.conf.broken
compute-0.localdomain

Change-Id: Ie177d09222b9d364e58deed402855462f463c06a
Closes-Bug: #1828269

commit_message:
Fix --limit option in image list sub-command

Client site fix of --limit option.

This bugfix makes client "image list" command working again with
"--limit" option. This option was ignored and even if user specified it,
still list of all available images was returned.

Story: 2004314
Change-Id: I30a78d65a644c9b7d23706a6637ce77bca2c2386
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/634776/

[{'created': '2019-04-19 01:55:14.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fix target_cell usage for scatter_gather_cells"

This reverts commit 3cc3cc453dc16e22365bea597c1be5bb0be57aeb.

We had determined that this commit had not actually fixed any bug or
issue with:

  TypeError: Can't upgrade a READER transaction to a WRITER
             mid-transaction

and the real fix was change Id24dea7465bafc1f6f58c4a121c4ffb35b7a634a.

This reverts the unnecessary commit in order to simplify the code and
it's possible that targeting the context before spawning a thread will
result in decreased cell cache lock contention once the threads are
spawned.

Related-Bug: #1722404

 Conflicts:
	nova/context.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is due to change
I861b223ee46b0f0a31f646a4b45f8a02410253cf which is new since the
original commit had landed.

Change-Id: I3890d14d8679b96cfebcd735f3b03ec808730b5c

commit_message:
Revert "Fix target_cell usage for scatter_gather_cells"

This reverts commit 3cc3cc453dc16e22365bea597c1be5bb0be57aeb.

We had determined that this commit had not actually fixed any bug or
issue with:

  TypeError: Can't upgrade a READER transaction to a WRITER
             mid-transaction

and the real fix was change Id24dea7465bafc1f6f58c4a121c4ffb35b7a634a.

This reverts the unnecessary commit in order to simplify the code and
it's possible that targeting the context before spawning a thread will
result in decreased cell cache lock contention once the threads are
spawned.

Related-Bug: #1722404

 Conflicts:
	nova/context.py

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is due to change
I861b223ee46b0f0a31f646a4b45f8a02410253cf which is new since the
original commit had landed.

Change-Id: I3890d14d8679b96cfebcd735f3b03ec808730b5c

after update_quota_class_set to check whether the quota values
are really changed.

'}, {'created': '2019-04-24 03:10:57.000000000', 'message': 'Use show_quota_class_set after update_quota_class_set

In test_update_default_quotas, we should use show_quota_class_set
after update_quota_class_set to check whether the quota values
are really changed.
Besides, some LOG messages look odd and maybe being used as comments
are more suitable.

Change-Id: I05e22c88e184df7d425411051c2a8bf846cb35ee
'}]
commit_message:
Use show_quota_class_set after update_quota_class_set

In test_update_default_quotas, we should use show_quota_class_set
after update_quota_class_set to check whether the quota values
are really changed.
Besides, some LOG messages look odd and maybe being used as comments
are more suitable.

Change-Id: I05e22c88e184df7d425411051c2a8bf846cb35ee

commit_message:
allow an empty string to unset options

For command `alarm update`, options like `--alarm-actions` cannot be
unset. Update utils to allow user to pass in an empty string in command
line to unset these values.

Change-Id: Ib6c712d8ad1a69b16dfef83362c576e80223f5a2

commit_message:
Update `get_allowed_transfer_protocol_values()`

These changes update `get_allowed_transfer_protocol_values()`.
According to [1], "If transfer protocol is not specified by a scheme
contained within ImageURI, the Update Service shall use HTTP to retrieve
the image."

So, when imageURI does not contain any transfer protocol,
`get_allowed_transfer_protocol_values()` should return a single protocol
value.

[1] https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/UpdateService.v1_4_0.json

A follow up patch to Change-Id:
I7477d4463491f99368f1a5981bce2ddacf612a8c

Change-Id: I42cb1cf982f36fffd5915811c6c12c01d191c453

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-07 11:39:28.000000000', 'message': 'Use migration_status during volume migrating and retyping

When swapping volumes Nova has to identify if the swap itself is related
to an underlying migration or retype of the volume by Cinder.  Nova
would previously use the status of the volume to determine if the volume
was retyping or migrating.

However in the migration case where a volume is moved directly between
hosts the volume is never given a status  of migrating by Cinder leading
to Nova never calling the os-migrate_volume_completion cinder API to
complete the migration.

This change switches Nova to use the migration_status of the volume to
ensure that this API is called for both retypes and migrations.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639331/
Change-Id: I1bdf3431bda2da98380e0dcaa9f952e6768ca3af
Closes-bug: #1803961
(cherry picked from commit 53c3cfa7a02d684ce27800e22e00a816af44c510)
'}]
commit_message:
Use migration_status during volume migrating and retyping

When swapping volumes Nova has to identify if the swap itself is related
to an underlying migration or retype of the volume by Cinder.  Nova
would previously use the status of the volume to determine if the volume
was retyping or migrating.

However in the migration case where a volume is moved directly between
hosts the volume is never given a status  of migrating by Cinder leading
to Nova never calling the os-migrate_volume_completion cinder API to
complete the migration.

This change switches Nova to use the migration_status of the volume to
ensure that this API is called for both retypes and migrations.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/639331/
Change-Id: I1bdf3431bda2da98380e0dcaa9f952e6768ca3af
Closes-bug: #1803961
(cherry picked from commit 53c3cfa7a02d684ce27800e22e00a816af44c510)

[{'created': '2019-05-08 20:03:31.000000000', 'message': "Raise lower constraint for taskflow

Versions below 3.4.0 didn't have caps on networkx dependency based on
python version, causing some failures in python 2.7. This raises to the
minimum version where requirements were updated to include that.

commit_message:
Raise lower constraint for taskflow

Versions below 3.4.0 didn't have caps on networkx dependency based on
python version, causing some failures in python 2.7. This raises to the
minimum version where requirements were updated to include that.

Change-Id: Ic126514fbbf171ed876862440401e3e15e7d7a92
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Add Elasticsearch image with s3 plugin

This adds the Elasticsearch image used in openstack-helm-infra
that's built with an elasticsearch:5.6.4 base with the s3 plugin
installed

commit_message:
Mount /usr/libexec/kubernetes/ for FlexVolumes

When using kubernetes flex volume plugin, it fails to be
mounted by the kubelet because the flexvolume path is not
set and mounted by the kubelet atomic system container.
This patch fixes it by adding the mount.

Task: 29569
Story: 2005053

Change-Id: I5511a14f3e5d4cbe7c7c210354aea6a871bd552d

commit_message:
Add TMP and TMPDIR to tox.ini's passenv

...mainly because I'm tired of needing to add it manually when I want to
run unit tests and then back it out before committing.

commit_message:
Fix networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-master-fedora

the periodic job was failing since controller was not defined [1],
fix it with using the proper nodeset for devstack jobs.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/master/networking-ovn-tempest-dsvm-ovs-master-fedora/08704a8/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-05-01_06_41_23_800960

[{'created': '2019-04-10 15:36:41.000000000', 'message': 'Use AssociationProxyInstance instead of AssociationProxy

Since [1], an AssociationProxy proxy instance is an
AssociationProxyInstance derivative object.

In order to import versions SQLAlchemy>=1.3.x, we need to handle
both implementations.

[1]https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/6446e0dfd3e3bb60754bad81c4d52345733d94e3

Change-Id: Ieba1a0315b4588841210078fa13f99f3d5275426
Closes-Bug: #1824178
'}, {'created': '2019-04-16 14:07:38.000000000', 'message': 'Use AssociationProxyInstance instead of AssociationProxy

commit_message:
Use AssociationProxyInstance instead of AssociationProxy

Since [1], an AssociationProxy proxy instance is an
AssociationProxyInstance derivative object.

In order to import versions SQLAlchemy>=1.3.x, we need to handle
both implementations.

[1]https://github.com/sqlalchemy/sqlalchemy/commit/6446e0dfd3e3bb60754bad81c4d52345733d94e3

Change-Id: Ieba1a0315b4588841210078fa13f99f3d5275426
Closes-Bug: #1824178

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-08 02:28:52.000000000', 'message': "Fix DBDeadLock error resulting into 500

When user requests the record registration request continuously,
sometimes designate hits DBDeadLock resuting into 500 InternalServerError.

We get below error:

2019-02-21 21:30:39.925 49752 ERROR designate.api.middleware RemoteError:
Remote error: DBDeadlock (pymysql.err.InternalError)
(1213, u'Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction')
[SQL: u'UPDATE records SET version=(records.version + %(version_1)s),
updated_at=%(updated_at)s, data=%(data)s, hash=%(hash)s, status=%(status)s,
action=%(action)s, serial=%(serial)s WHERE records.id = %(id_1)s']
[parameters: {'status': 'PENDING', 'hash': '39795ee18c6e3c9ad1c0190c6a3d8d4f',
'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 2, 21, 12, 30, 39, 909846), u'version_1': 1,
u'id_1': '7a655eeda4d446cdaa81caf19ab55fcc', 'action': 'UPDATE',
'serial': 1550752338,
'data': u'ns2.example.jp. domain.example.com. 1550752338 3552 600 86400 3600'}]

In the process of record registeration, designate first tried to update
the reocrd and then update the zone status.

Updating the zone_status and registering the record process[1] and after synced
update record_status and zone_status process[2] are in reverse order. So If user
request the registering record many time and same time, Designate will get the
DBDeadLock, when these processes run the same time.

We observed that changing the order of the operations solves this issue.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L1292-L1320
[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L2310-L2322

1. transaction [1]-1 updating zone status process <- run    ---> table_name-zone
2. transaction [2]-1 updating record status process <- run  ---> table_name-record
3. transaction [1]-2 registering record process <- run and wait  ---> table_name-record
4. transaction [2]-2 updating zone process <-deadlock!           ---> table_name-zone

Change-Id: Icd6e690ac84a2fe0db0f4a8a513de47f7916f5ea
Related-Bug: #1785459
(cherry picked from commit f828654a3d40476cac7eb24a09a36e9978c2d708)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DBDeadLock error resulting into 500

When user requests the record registration request continuously,
sometimes designate hits DBDeadLock resuting into 500 InternalServerError.

We get below error:

2019-02-21 21:30:39.925 49752 ERROR designate.api.middleware RemoteError:
Remote error: DBDeadlock (pymysql.err.InternalError)
(1213, u'Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction')
[SQL: u'UPDATE records SET version=(records.version + %(version_1)s),
updated_at=%(updated_at)s, data=%(data)s, hash=%(hash)s, status=%(status)s,
action=%(action)s, serial=%(serial)s WHERE records.id = %(id_1)s']
[parameters: {'status': 'PENDING', 'hash': '39795ee18c6e3c9ad1c0190c6a3d8d4f',
'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 2, 21, 12, 30, 39, 909846), u'version_1': 1,
u'id_1': '7a655eeda4d446cdaa81caf19ab55fcc', 'action': 'UPDATE',
'serial': 1550752338,
'data': u'ns2.example.jp. domain.example.com. 1550752338 3552 600 86400 3600'}]

In the process of record registeration, designate first tried to update
the reocrd and then update the zone status.

Updating the zone_status and registering the record process[1] and after synced
update record_status and zone_status process[2] are in reverse order. So If user
request the registering record many time and same time, Designate will get the
DBDeadLock, when these processes run the same time.

We observed that changing the order of the operations solves this issue.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L1292-L1320
[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L2310-L2322

1. transaction [1]-1 updating zone status process <- run    ---> table_name-zone
2. transaction [2]-1 updating record status process <- run  ---> table_name-record
3. transaction [1]-2 registering record process <- run and wait  ---> table_name-record
4. transaction [2]-2 updating zone process <-deadlock!           ---> table_name-zone

Change-Id: Icd6e690ac84a2fe0db0f4a8a513de47f7916f5ea
Related-Bug: #1785459
(cherry picked from commit f828654a3d40476cac7eb24a09a36e9978c2d708)

[{'created': '2019-05-07 21:26:33.000000000', 'message': 'Enable ndisc_notify sysctl setting to notify of MAC changes

On RHEL/CentOS systems, ndisc_notify is disabled by default. When
OVS restarts or an internal port flaps, the MAC address may change.
Without ndisc_notify, neighbor hosts on the same network will not
know about the MAC change, and will lose connectivity until the MAC
timer expires.

This change sets net.ipv6.conf.all.ndisc_notify to 1, which will

Closes-bug: 1827927
(cherry picked from commit 4b113a7a1287f30e0e57abf4e3c74870d4720534)

commit_message:
Enable ndisc_notify sysctl setting to notify of MAC changes

On RHEL/CentOS systems, ndisc_notify is disabled by default. When
OVS restarts or an internal port flaps, the MAC address may change.
Without ndisc_notify, neighbor hosts on the same network will not
know about the MAC change, and will lose connectivity until the MAC
timer expires.

This change sets net.ipv6.conf.all.ndisc_notify to 1, which will
cause a gratuitous neighbor discovery packet which will update MAC
address tables on neighboring hosts.

Change-Id: I89062275541d7c6bb6fb725f5283ba59feb38a94
Closes-bug: 1827927
(cherry picked from commit 4b113a7a1287f30e0e57abf4e3c74870d4720534)

commit_message:
Enable ndisc_notify sysctl setting to notify of MAC changes

On RHEL/CentOS systems, ndisc_notify is disabled by default. When
OVS restarts or an internal port flaps, the MAC address may change.
Without ndisc_notify, neighbor hosts on the same network will not
know about the MAC change, and will lose connectivity until the MAC
timer expires.

This change sets net.ipv6.conf.all.ndisc_notify to 1, which will
cause a gratuitous neighbor discovery packet which will update MAC
address tables on neighboring hosts.

Change-Id: I89062275541d7c6bb6fb725f5283ba59feb38a94
Closes-bug: 1827927
(cherry picked from commit 4b113a7a1287f30e0e57abf4e3c74870d4720534)

[{'created': '2019-05-08 14:37:19.000000000', 'message': 'Always deploy placement authtoken config

The placement service is required, nova cannot start without it,
so we must always configure the authtoken even if the flag to deploy
the integrated nova-placement-api is disabled. This will enable the
ability to move placement into a separate service, disable the
nova-placement-api deployment, yet still configure the required
authtoken in nova.conf.

Depends-On: I58788af6f02a4b339a270dff69a86ce7cdea41d3
Change-Id: I4619d333187a0e96c1b60fe2f203df0838c12059
'}]
commit_message:
Always deploy placement authtoken config

The placement service is required, nova cannot start without it,
so we must always configure the authtoken even if the flag to deploy
the integrated nova-placement-api is disabled. This will enable the
ability to move placement into a separate service, disable the
nova-placement-api deployment, yet still configure the required
authtoken in nova.conf.

Depends-On: I58788af6f02a4b339a270dff69a86ce7cdea41d3
Change-Id: I4619d333187a0e96c1b60fe2f203df0838c12059

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-13 21:21:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm afraid this doesn't go quite far enough.

Any time the contributes_to contains more than one value, I'm right back where I started, not being able to disambiguate which request group mapped to which chunk of the response.

If you use your last alternative, but key by the request group, you can solve this."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-09-17 11:44:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm afraid this doesn't go quite far enough.
 > 
 > Any time the contributes_to contains more than one value, I'm right
 > back where I started, not being able to disambiguate which request
 > group mapped to which chunk of the response.
 > 
 > If you use your last alternative, but key by the request group, you
 > can solve this.

The contributes_to field is added to each RP in each candidate in the a_c response so ambiguity only happens when an RP contributes to more than one request groups (e.g. group_policy=none). However that is a minor ambiguity as the individual contribution of that RP to multiple group can be calculated with a single subtraction on value of each allocated resource classes. Also your suggestion would not simplify this situation further."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-18 18:26:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> can be calculated with a single subtraction

Not a fan of requiring the caller to reverse-engineer the response based on the request.

> your suggestion would not simplify

Just so we're clear on what I'm suggesting, consider request:

 ?resources1=CUSTOM_FOO:1,CUSTOM_BAR:100
 &resources2=CUSTOM_FOO:2,CUSTOM_BAR:200
 &resources3=CUSTOM_FOO:1
 &group_policy=none

Response your way:

 "allocations": {
     $RP1: {
         "resources": {
             CUSTOM_FOO: 1,
             CUSTOM_BAR: 100,
         },
         "contributes_to": ["resources1"]
     },
     $RP2: {
         "resources": {
             CUSTOM_FOO: 3,
             CUSTOM_BAR: 200,
         },
         "contributes_to": ["resources2", "resources3"]
     },
 }

Now when processing RP2, I have to re-parse the resources2/3 I sent in the request to separate 3/200 into 2/200 and 1/0, right?

Response my way:

 "allocations": {
     "resources1": {
         $RP1: {
             CUSTOM_FOO: 1,
             CUSTOM_BAR: 100,
         }
     }
     "resources2": {
         $RP2: {
             CUSTOM_FOO: 2,
             CUSTOM_BAR: 200,
         }
     }
     "resources3": {
         $RP2: {
             CUSTOM_FOO: 1,
         }
     }
 }

No subtraction necessary. Furthermore, no need to access, understand, or parse the original request in whatever format (e.g. flavor extra specs, RequestGroup dict, etc.)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-27 13:21:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Response my way:
 > 
 > "allocations": {
 > "resources1": {
 > $RP1: {
 > CUSTOM_FOO: 1,
 > CUSTOM_BAR: 100,
 > }
 > }
 > "resources2": {
 > $RP2: {
 > CUSTOM_FOO: 2,
 > CUSTOM_BAR: 200,
 > }
 > }
 > "resources3": {
 > $RP2: {
 > CUSTOM_FOO: 1,
 > }
 > }
 > }

This format violates the contract of allocation_candidates which is that a single member of allocation_requests can be given back to  PUT /allocations without inspection.

We've already broken this promise a bit by by requiring project and user in some microversions, but we can do that without much knowledge of the structure.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-27 14:57:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This format violates the contract of allocation_candidates which is that a single member of allocation_requests can be given back to  PUT /allocations without inspection.

Obviously we will have to change PUT/POST /allocations to accept the new format, whether it's the one gibi suggests or the one I suggest. If you can think of a solution that *wouldn't* require PUT/POST /allocations to change, I'm all ears."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-27 15:12:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > This format violates the contract of allocation_candidates which
 > is that a single member of allocation_requests can be given back to
 >  PUT /allocations without inspection.
 > 
 > Obviously we will have to change PUT/POST /allocations to accept
 > the new format, whether it's the one gibi suggests or the one I
 > suggest. If you can think of a solution that *wouldn't* require
 > PUT/POST /allocations to change, I'm all ears.

There's the "*Alternatively* the mapping can be added as a separate top level key to the response."'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-27 16:30:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Perhaps I'm not understanding why it's a problem to change the GET /a_c format and the PUT/POST /allocations format in the same microversion."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-09-27 17:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Perhaps I'm not understanding why it's a problem to change the GET
 > /a_c format and the PUT/POST /allocations format in the same
 > microversion.

Because two things:

a) if the information is not needed in a PUT or POST to /allocations nor will be included in GET /allocations/{uuid} then it shouldn't be included. If those changes are expected and we are intended for this information to be _meaningful_ for allocations themselves, then we need to make that way more clear in this spec. As I understand things I thought this information was important with regards to how nova (or other clients) is grouping things, not to how placement is grouping things (when it persists allocations).

b) We spent some significant amount of time when creating allocation_candidates saying that the allocations in the allocation_requests are "opaque" in some kind of hand-wavey sort of way, meaning they are capable of being PUT directly back to placement. If we want to change that we _can_ but the choice to do so should not be lightly taken.

All of this goes back to the early idea that allocations are supposed to be the lightest and fastest aspect of placement. A thing that many thousands of clients can throw at placement as fast and stupidly as they possibly can.

Again, this doesn't mean the nature of allocations can't change, but that changing them ought to be considered a big deal.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-27 18:04:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

> Because two things:

Okay, I can buy that.

The way I see it, we've got several alternative designs (including a new suggestion inline), all of which have significant flaws, and we don't seem to be close to a consensus on which is the best (or least awful, anyway). As Chris notes, the "contributes_to" option, which seems to be the one being advocated by this spec, would need a lot more detail/discussion about the implications on the GET/PUT/POST /allocs operations. So my downvote is saying we either need to flesh that out, or reorganize to put one of the other alternatives to the front.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-05 15:38:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)

Very soft -1 to bikeshed on the name of the proposed new attribute in the allocation_request:resource_provider dict. I would prefer to name this "request_groups" instead of "contributes_to".

That said, good spec, Gibi. ++'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-05 16:28:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I continue to have some concerns about putting the mapping info in the body of allocation_requests.

For the common case mappings are not important. This suggests to me they should go somewhere else.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-05 22:02:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

It sounds like Jay would flip to +1 with a rename of the key. I still feel like we're not that close. See my previous review."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-12-04 09:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2019-02-11 20:17:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2019-02-20 05:31:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-22 00:05:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)

Revisited after several months, wherein we've developed some concrete examples of why this is needed.

I started off sequentially and wound up repeating a bunch of the things I had said previously a bit further down. Tried to clean that up, but there may still be some dups, sorry.

TL;DR: No question we need this, but I don't think the design is quite there yet. Last comment has a suggestion that hopefully satisfies most-function-for-least-ugly."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-02-28 13:36:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

A couple of comments within. The second (longer) one provides some thoughts on the response structure and why we want things to be particular ways.

The -1 is basically to flag "yeah, we haven't decided this yet"

Also: Are there already prototypes or even "real" code in place that is doing this the nova-or-neutron-side way? That is version of duplicating some placement work. Have we seen it yet to definitively say that it is horrible? I guess the in-progress bandwidth stuff is? How's it seem?

I'm asking because I'm wondering there's a way to move this forward in two steps: do it the less than great way first, without a dependency on placement changing, learn from that, and do it the most informed way later.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-02-28 22:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

> Also: Are there already prototypes or even "real" code in place that is doing this the nova-or-neutron-side way? That is version of duplicating some placement work.

Yes.

> Have we seen it yet to definitively say that it is horrible? I guess the in-progress bandwidth stuff is? How's it seem?

Yes. It's horrible. I've linked to some of it inline.

> I'm asking because I'm wondering there's a way to move this forward in two steps: do it the less than great way first, without a dependency on placement changing, learn from that, and do it the most informed way later.

From having done it the horrible way, we have learned that having this feature as described would be helpful. I don't think the exercise of doing it the horrible way has changed anything significant about what we think the interface ought to look like; that is, I don't think it pushes the discussion we've already been having in this spec in one direction or another.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-03-04 14:02:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

While I've used gabbi as an example within for why nested data structure changes are pad, it's just an example. Any other system that is accessing data-by-path would be impacted."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-03-04 22:51:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-03-05 01:50:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

pedantry bait taken'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-04-02 15:08:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As this is primarily a placement spec, we'll want to get this resubmitted to openstack/placement:doc/source/specs

But there's a lot of useful and undigested discussion here.  Any suggestions on how to proceed."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-02 15:22:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> As this is primarily a placement spec, we'll want to get this resubmitted to openstack/placement:doc/source/specs
> 
> But there's a lot of useful and undigested discussion here.  Any suggestions on how to proceed.

Yeah, good point Chris.

I agree this needs to be moved to a placement spec, but we don't want to lose the history. We can point back to this review from the new incarnation. It's not ideal, but it'll work. And then abandon this one.

It would be nice if the first PS of the placement spec matched the last PS of this one, for diffability. IMO better to do that by updating this one and then copying it over, so that the latest updates can stay in context of the comments that prompted them."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-04-10 14:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Note, this is being discussed in the ML: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004819.html'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-05-07 11:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-05-07 11:54:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(11 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-05-07 11:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Update the spec based on the the recent discussions.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2019-05-07 11:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Placement development is moved to a separate repo as well as the spec process. So this patch is superseded by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657582/'}]

commit_message:
Resource provider - request group mapping in allocation candidate

To support QoS minimum bandwidth policy during server scheduling
Neutron needs to know which resource provider provides the bandwidth
resource for each port in the server create request.

bp placement-resource-provider-request-group-mapping-in-allocation-candidates

Change-Id: Iafdb0eab9b41f4c34c93cada08a4da27cf4b1499

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-29 15:34:29.000000000', 'message': "Revert iptables TCP checksum-fill code

To fix bug 1722584 we inserted a checksum-fill rule for
metadata proxy replies.  Recent kernels have disabled
this support for TCP because it was invalid, and
supposedly not doing anything, so let's get ahead of
things and remove the code.

Kernel mailing list discussion is at
https://lore.kernel.org/patchwork/patch/824819/

Partially reverts ed1c3b021751273e427d47fcf544c56bdabf97bb

Change-Id: Ib7cc8f82a91972f17987fb95130edc4069d9423f
Related-bug: #1722584
(cherry picked from commit b1b8a438fe3cdc422b8deb61548f47d383ee2fe8)
"}]
commit_message:
Revert iptables TCP checksum-fill code

To fix bug 1722584 we inserted a checksum-fill rule for
metadata proxy replies.  Recent kernels have disabled
this support for TCP because it was invalid, and
supposedly not doing anything, so let's get ahead of
things and remove the code.

Kernel mailing list discussion is at
https://lore.kernel.org/patchwork/patch/824819/

Partially reverts ed1c3b021751273e427d47fcf544c56bdabf97bb

Change-Id: Ib7cc8f82a91972f17987fb95130edc4069d9423f
Related-bug: #1722584
(cherry picked from commit b1b8a438fe3cdc422b8deb61548f47d383ee2fe8)

commit_message:
Always close all passed in fds beyond sensible_fd_limit on launch

Change Idd98c183eca3e2df8648fc0f37d27fe9cc6d0563 stopped closing
filedescriptors beyond the sensible_fd_limit. With this patch
the previous behavior is restored. We can close the fds more efficiently
by just iterating over /proc/self/fd on Linux and only change
the rlimit/MAXFD setting when successful.

Change-Id: I3b481ddd14ae2b948270d715aad157cf3996def7

- Rename key, to enable helm test, to same as other charts.

commit_message:
Remove unused Magnum module

This module is not used in the openstack-ansible project and there is a
native ansible module for the same purpose. There will be no supporting
changes for this fix to remove it from use because it is not being used.

Patch set 2: Add release note

Change-Id: Ia516ccfc024218ccfb143d600268875c9013cc22
Closes-bug: #1826247

commit_message:
Stop queens translation

We only translate the latest two releases - stein and rocky -, so stop
translating queens. There's also no activity from translators this
month on queens.

Change-Id: I3866500c25f915138ce304397e1a082cd2c7f4b2

commit_message:
libvirt: update logic to configure device for scsi controller

When using virtio-scsi it is possible to handle up to 256 disk but
because we do not specifically set the information about the
controller only 6 can be handled.

This commit is fixing the issue by adding the address element to the
disk configuration.

Closes-Bug: #1686116
Change-Id: I98e53b378cc99747765066001a0b51880543d2dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-08 02:27:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix DBDeadLock error resulting into 500

When user requests the record registration request continuously,
sometimes designate hits DBDeadLock resuting into 500 InternalServerError.

We get below error:

2019-02-21 21:30:39.925 49752 ERROR designate.api.middleware RemoteError:
Remote error: DBDeadlock (pymysql.err.InternalError)
(1213, u'Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction')
[SQL: u'UPDATE records SET version=(records.version + %(version_1)s),
updated_at=%(updated_at)s, data=%(data)s, hash=%(hash)s, status=%(status)s,
action=%(action)s, serial=%(serial)s WHERE records.id = %(id_1)s']
[parameters: {'status': 'PENDING', 'hash': '39795ee18c6e3c9ad1c0190c6a3d8d4f',
'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 2, 21, 12, 30, 39, 909846), u'version_1': 1,
u'id_1': '7a655eeda4d446cdaa81caf19ab55fcc', 'action': 'UPDATE',
'serial': 1550752338,
'data': u'ns2.example.jp. domain.example.com. 1550752338 3552 600 86400 3600'}]

In the process of record registeration, designate first tried to update
the reocrd and then update the zone status.

Updating the zone_status and registering the record process[1] and after synced
update record_status and zone_status process[2] are in reverse order. So If user
request the registering record many time and same time, Designate will get the
DBDeadLock, when these processes run the same time.

We observed that changing the order of the operations solves this issue.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L1292-L1320
[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L2310-L2322

1. transaction [1]-1 updating zone status process <- run    ---> table_name-zone
2. transaction [2]-1 updating record status process <- run  ---> table_name-record
3. transaction [1]-2 registering record process <- run and wait  ---> table_name-record
4. transaction [2]-2 updating zone process <-deadlock!           ---> table_name-zone

Change-Id: Icd6e690ac84a2fe0db0f4a8a513de47f7916f5ea
Related-Bug: #1785459
(cherry picked from commit f828654a3d40476cac7eb24a09a36e9978c2d708)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix DBDeadLock error resulting into 500

When user requests the record registration request continuously,
sometimes designate hits DBDeadLock resuting into 500 InternalServerError.

We get below error:

2019-02-21 21:30:39.925 49752 ERROR designate.api.middleware RemoteError:
Remote error: DBDeadlock (pymysql.err.InternalError)
(1213, u'Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction')
[SQL: u'UPDATE records SET version=(records.version + %(version_1)s),
updated_at=%(updated_at)s, data=%(data)s, hash=%(hash)s, status=%(status)s,
action=%(action)s, serial=%(serial)s WHERE records.id = %(id_1)s']
[parameters: {'status': 'PENDING', 'hash': '39795ee18c6e3c9ad1c0190c6a3d8d4f',
'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2019, 2, 21, 12, 30, 39, 909846), u'version_1': 1,
u'id_1': '7a655eeda4d446cdaa81caf19ab55fcc', 'action': 'UPDATE',
'serial': 1550752338,
'data': u'ns2.example.jp. domain.example.com. 1550752338 3552 600 86400 3600'}]

In the process of record registeration, designate first tried to update
the reocrd and then update the zone status.

Updating the zone_status and registering the record process[1] and after synced
update record_status and zone_status process[2] are in reverse order. So If user
request the registering record many time and same time, Designate will get the
DBDeadLock, when these processes run the same time.

We observed that changing the order of the operations solves this issue.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L1292-L1320
[2] https://github.com/openstack/designate/blob/master/designate/central/service.py#L2310-L2322

1. transaction [1]-1 updating zone status process <- run    ---> table_name-zone
2. transaction [2]-1 updating record status process <- run  ---> table_name-record
3. transaction [1]-2 registering record process <- run and wait  ---> table_name-record
4. transaction [2]-2 updating zone process <-deadlock!           ---> table_name-zone

Change-Id: Icd6e690ac84a2fe0db0f4a8a513de47f7916f5ea
Related-Bug: #1785459
(cherry picked from commit f828654a3d40476cac7eb24a09a36e9978c2d708)

commit_message:
Add libpq-dev to bindeps.txt and install doc

Because it is needed to install psycopg 2.8.2 on ubuntu. Resolves
dependency install failure on unit tests on ubuntu nodes.

Change-Id: I04e9272e351badc1344235571d6f2c9e79fb6223
Closes-Bug: 1828109

commit_message:
Remove install_test_requirements flag

Due to tempest plugin split, all the tempest plugin requirements
are kept in requirements.txt, not in test_requirements.txt, so
it does not make any sense to install it.

So removing the flag from the role.

Change-Id: I7600f1750538335c1348e7d042e6bf450910e12c
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make scenario jobs voting

This change makes the scenario jobs for neutron-dynamic-routing
voting jobs. Given recent changes to stabilize these jobs, the
recent track record of stability, and the value they provide,
it is time to turn these jobs voting jobs.

Change-Id: I859753a7699491213d3eea30346a71dff438f483

commit_message:
Make openstackdocstheme an optional doc dependency

cliff is a library that is used outside of OpenStack, too. Having
a build requirement that needs something OpenStack specific makes
life in cases (eg. for downstream packagers) more difficult.
So let's make openstackdocstheme an optional requirement.

Change-Id: I0f94a431be083b8b4baec850b1885ba07b5bf5c2
(cherry picked from commit 5c37935139892a96fe11a563dda9fdcce31edba4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-30 15:23:29.000000000', 'message': 'Check if volume type exists with name in create_volume_type

Before change I45bc7043a513056740ec1beef147422ed9b035a8 all
volume types that tempest creates would have a random name.
After that change, if the test creates a volume type with a
given name, it's not unique and therefore can hit a 409
conflict trying to create a volume type with a name that already
exists, which can happen when running scenario tests concurrently
since several encrypted volume tests use the same volume type
name "luks". This change resolves the issue by handling the 409
conflict and checks to see if a volume type with the same name
and optionally the same backend name exist and if so, it just
returns that volume type, otherwise the conflict error is re-raised.

Change-Id: Iecf62d411d2da17c4c983915018e3ed9180ecd11
Closes-Bug: #1826953
'}, {'created': '2019-04-30 15:32:03.000000000', 'message': 'Check if volume type exists with name in create_volume_type

Before change I45bc7043a513056740ec1beef147422ed9b035a8 all
volume types that tempest creates would have a random name.
After that change, if the test creates a volume type with a
given name, it's not unique and therefore can hit a 409
conflict trying to create a volume type with a name that already
exists, which can happen when running scenario tests concurrently
since several encrypted volume tests use the same volume type
name "luks". This change resolves the issue by handling the 409
conflict and checks to see if a volume type with the same name
and optionally the same backend name exist and if so, it just
returns that volume type, otherwise the conflict error is re-raised.

Change-Id: Iecf62d411d2da17c4c983915018e3ed9180ecd11
Closes-Bug: #1826953
'}]
commit_message:
Check if volume type exists with name in create_volume_type

Before change I45bc7043a513056740ec1beef147422ed9b035a8 all
volume types that tempest creates would have a random name.
After that change, if the test creates a volume type with a
given name, it's not unique and therefore can hit a 409
conflict trying to create a volume type with a name that already
exists, which can happen when running scenario tests concurrently
since several encrypted volume tests use the same volume type
name "luks". This change resolves the issue by handling the 409
conflict and checks to see if a volume type with the same name
and optionally the same backend name exist and if so, it just
returns that volume type, otherwise the conflict error is re-raised.

Change-Id: Iecf62d411d2da17c4c983915018e3ed9180ecd11
Closes-Bug: #1826953

commit_message:
Change networking-ovn tripleo job to run against fs10

Right now, scenario03 (fs18) is broken in TripleO. This patch
is changing the job definition in our gate to use fs10 instead.
We should revert this once TripleO fixes sc03 to have a more
complete testing (pacemaker, mistral, ...).

Change-Id: I429be059743ce6ae79a0b68ed1fac6b307e5e4b1
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez Sanchez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Dockerfile to build a SAIO container image

Added Dockerfile and configuration files under the
new `docker` directory to build a Swift All in One container
image.

The primary goal of this container image is to provide
application developers with a Swift/S3 endpoint that can be
tested against during the development cycle.

Added Zuul jobs to build docker container

Change-Id: Ib10975a1862a4fa8c4eeaba139837cf1f22b272a

commit_message:
Introduce an attached volume migration test

This change introduces a true cinder host to host attached volume
migration test in addition to the existing attached volume retype test.
To enable this two new calls are introduced to the v3 volume client to
allow all volume backends to be listed per project and to also call for
a direct volume migration between backends.

Related-bug: #1803961
Depends-On: I1bdf3431bda2da98380e0dcaa9f952e6768ca3af
Change-Id: I501eb0cd5eb101b4dc553c2cdbc414693dd5b681

Thanks for the patch, but could you please fix all the incorrect param for the exception DnsRecordNotFound and UserNotFound in the whole repo? I can see there are some others also need this change.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-04-22 01:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Thanks for the patch, but could you please fix all the incorrect
 > param for the exception DnsRecordNotFound and UserNotFound in the
 > whole repo? I can see there are some others also need this change.

Sorry I seem not be able to find other DnsRecordNotFound and UserNotFound that need to be fixed, could you point out the position?'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-22 04:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Sorry I seem not be able to find other DnsRecordNotFound and
 > UserNotFound that need to be fixed, could you point out the

By searching UserNotFound, I can see all those references, https://paste.pics/ddf225202ad0007e622ff1c4a5582fb4'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-04-22 05:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Sorry I seem not be able to find other DnsRecordNotFound and

 > > position?
 > 
 > By searching UserNotFound, I can see all those references,
 > https://paste.pics/ddf225202ad0007e622ff1c4a5582fb4

oh, if we pass formatted message directly to UserNotFound, it can also work, like
"trove/tests/fakes/guestagent.py:304:            raise rd_exception.UserNotFound(
trove/tests/fakes/guestagent.py-305-                "User %s cannot be found on the instance." % username)"

so I just leave them unchanged.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-04-22 05:44:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

OK, don't worry, thanks for the explanation."}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-04-22 06:10:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for the quick response:)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2019-05-08 12:43:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Pass kwargs to exception to get better format of error message

If we do not pass kwargs to exception, the parameter will be deemed
as message and will be displayed directly. This is to pass kwargs to
some exceptions, to get better format of error message.

Change-Id: Ia7d0ec0152de9ee4bdf10c8de80e8d32bbf4a42b

[{'created': '2019-04-19 10:19:01.000000000', 'message': 'Disable image building for functional tests

The following CI jobs are creating related guest images using trovestack
script, so we could skip the image build step in devstack to decrease
the testing duration.

The previous duration before this patch is put here for comparison:

trove-functional-mysql  1h 09m 12s
trove-scenario-mariadb-single  42m 27s
trove-scenario-mariadb-multi  50m 05s
trove-scenario-mysql-single  48m 35s
trove-scenario-mysql-multi  45m 32s
trove-scenario-postgresql-single  48m 35s
trove-scenario-postgresql-multi  56m 03s
trove-scenario-pxc-single  1h 01m 41s
trove-scenario-pxc-multi  1h 04m 15s
trove-scenario-redis-single  1h 00m 32s
trove-scenario-redis-multi  58m 02s

Change-Id: Iefef03066c1a054bf760f83a66ce7795ad92c44a

Task: #30590

'}, {'created': '2019-04-19 12:42:29.000000000', 'message': "Skip image building in DevStack for functional tests

DevStack builds a mysql guest image by default, but trovestack is used
heavily in Trove functional test and image building is also part of the
script. This patch disables the image building in devstack so we could
save some time for CI.

Although mysql related tests won't build image in trovestack, we change
it anyway to keep consistent with the others.

trove-scenario-pxc-multi  1h 04m 15s
trove-scenario-redis-single  1h 00m 32s
trove-scenario-redis-multi  58m 02s

commit_message:
Skip image building in DevStack for functional tests

DevStack builds a mysql guest image by default, but trovestack is used
heavily in Trove functional test and image building is also part of the
script.

This patch disables the image building in devstack for all functional
CI jobs except the mysql ones so we could save some time for those jobs.

Change-Id: Iefef03066c1a054bf760f83a66ce7795ad92c44a
Story: #2005490
Task: #30590

commit_message:
Add MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class

Add a resource class representing the number of guests a compute node
can host concurrently with memory encrypted at the hardware level.

Initially this is required because on AMD SEV-capable hardware, the
memory controller has a fixed number of slots for holding encryption
keys, one per guest.  Typical hardware only has 15 slots, thereby
limiting the number of SEV guests which can be run concurrently to 15.
nova needs to track how many slots are available and used in order to
avoid attempting to exceeding that limit in the hardware.

In the future support may be added for equivalent functionality from
other vendors, such as Intel MKTME; however it is not yet known
whether MKTME would have a similar limit.

See

  http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html

for more details, and

  http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2019-04-23.log.html#t2019-04-23T20:35:19
  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/641994/

for the bike-shedding discussion over the name.

Change-Id: I97a015d4070db947e4b96fb35021da01d61016cc
blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

those are automated users that are created by Heat and the should
not be subject to restrictions possibly configured in Keystone
for security compliance, as those may break automated nature of things.

Create domain users with several available user options that will
make Keystone ignore:
- password expiry
- requirement to change the password on first use
- lockout after failed auth attempts

There are more things that must be done to properly secure those users
from becoming non-working, but this will be proposed in the followup
patches.

Task: 29988

Change-Id: I3152ddb82426cf66f2bd8ed69f53c77c653142bf

commit_message:
Add special user options for domain user

those are automated users that are created by Heat and the should
not be subject to restrictions possibly configured in Keystone
for security compliance, as those may break automated nature of things.

Create domain users with several available user options that will
make Keystone ignore:
- password expiry
- requirement to change the password on first use
- lockout after failed auth attempts

There are more things that must be done to properly secure those users
from becoming non-working, but this will be proposed in the followup
patches.

Story: 2005210
Task: 29988

Change-Id: I3152ddb82426cf66f2bd8ed69f53c77c653142bf
